results.title: Circadian blood pressure overswinging in a physically fit, normotensive African American woman.
results.text_hl: A 12-week treatment with the @GENE_ADRB1 @GENE_153 @@@beta1-adrenoceptor@@@ blocker @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, 14 months post-training, normalized @<m>DISEASE_Chronobiology_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D021081 @@@CHAT@@@ and HR variability and further reduced BP and HR.

citations.NLM: Borer KT, Cornelissen G, Halberg F, Brook R, Rajagopalan S, Fay W. Circadian blood pressure overswinging in a physically fit, normotensive African American woman. Am J Hypertens. 2002 Sep;15(9):827-30. PMID: 12219880
citations.BibTeX: @article{12219880, title={Circadian blood pressure overswinging in a physically fit, normotensive African American woman.}, author={Borer KT and Cornelissen G and Halberg F and Brook R and Rajagopalan S and Fay W}, journal={Am J Hypertens}, volume={15}, number={9}, pages={827-30}}

results.title: Effects of autogenic training and antihypertensive agents on circadian and circaseptan variation of blood pressure.
results.text_hl: Accordingly, long-acting @CHEMICAL_Carteolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002354 @@@carteolol@@@ (N = 11) and/or @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (N = 8) may be preferred to @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@ retard (N = 13), @CHEMICAL_nilvadipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C035100 @@@nilvadipine@@@ (N = 8), or @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ (N = 7) for midline-estimating statistic of rhythm (MESOR)-@DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Chronobiology_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D021081 @@@CHAT@@@.

citations.NLM: Watanabe Y, Cornélissen G, Watanabe M, Watanabe F, Otsuka K, Ohkawa S, Kikuchi T, Halberg F. Effects of autogenic training and antihypertensive agents on circadian and circaseptan variation of blood pressure. Clin Exp Hypertens. 2003 Oct;25(7):405-12. PMID: 14596365
